text: Ernest Courant (March 26, 1920 â€“ April 21, 2020) was a German-born American physicist. He was important for the creation of modern large-scale particle accelerator concepts. His most notable discovery was his 1952 work with Milton S. Livingston and Hartland Snyder on the Strong focusing principle, a critical step in the development of modern particle accelerators like the synchrotron. Courant was a member of the National Academy of Sciences. He worked at Brookhaven National Laboratory.
